intro: Spermacoce siberiana, commonly known as Siberian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the colder regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments and has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds. Spermacoce siberiana is often found in forest understories and is adapted to temperate climates.
